definition: sheer cliffs and precipitous rock faces (idiom)
to hang or suspend/to worry/public announcement/unresolved/baseless/without foundation

sentences.english: Nevertheless, the high cliffs and peaks are often shrouded in clouds and mist.
sentences.chinese: 且懸崖峭壁縈繞在雲霧之中。

sentences.english: Standing on the cliffs, he gazed at the distant shoreline of France.
sentences.chinese: 站在懸崖峭壁上，他凝視着遠處的法國海岸線。

sentences.english: Nearby Mirror Lake offers beautiful reflections of the surrounding cliffs.
sentences.chinese: 附近的鏡湖給遊客欣賞到水中的懸崖峭壁倒映。

sentences.english: It takes courage and strength to climb up the perpendicular cliff.
sentences.chinese: 攀上這懸崖峭壁需要勇氣和力量。

sentences.english: I think they probably call that because it's right here on the cliffs.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得之所以這麼叫，是因爲它在懸崖峭壁上。

sentences.english: For Taoism the most imposing temple is Infinity Temple who was built half way up the steep mountains and has very strange layout.
sentences.chinese: 最雄奇的道教建築是坐落在懸崖峭壁上無窮觀。

pinyin: Xi3 ma3 la1 ya3 shan1 mai4

definition: tall and erect, reaching through the clouds (idiom); used to describe tall mountain or skyscraper
topography of a mountain/features of a mountain
strategically situated and easy to defend/strategic location
Qutang Gorge, 8 km long gorge on the Changjiang or Yangtze in Chongqing 重慶|重庆[Chong2 qing4], the upper of the Three Gorges 三峽|三峡[San1 Xia2]
green grass like cushion (idiom); green meadow so inviting to sleep on
plank walkway constructed on the face of a cliff/(archaic) elevated passageway connecting the upper levels of adjacent towers
